For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. # United Airlines Holdings, Inc. (UAL) Sell-Side Analysis Report

**Report Date:** October 11, 2024  
**Current Stock Price:** $59.58 (as of market close October 11, 2024, per Yahoo Finance and Nasdaq)  
**Market Capitalization:** $19.57 billion (verified via Yahoo Finance, October 11, 2024)  
**52-Week Range:** $39.37 - $69.44  

## Company Overview (198 words)
United Airlines Holdings, Inc. (UAL) is one of the world's largest airlines by available seat miles (ASMs), operating a mainline fleet of over 800 aircraft and serving more than 170 destinations across six continents via its United Express regional network. Headquartered in Chicago, United maintains major hubs at Newark Liberty (EWR), Chicago O'Hare (ORD), Denver (DEN), Houston Intercontinental (IAH), Los Angeles (LAX), San Francisco (SFO), and Washington Dulles (IAD). As a founding member of the Star Alliance (joined 1997), it offers extensive codeshare and interline partnerships for seamless global connectivity.

United generates revenue primarily from passenger operations (85-90%), cargo, and loyalty programs like MileagePlus, which boasts over 100 million members. The carrier emphasizes premium products (e.g., Polaris business class, Premium Plus) amid rising demand for high-margin cabins. Post-COVID recovery has been robust, with 2023 revenue hitting $53.7 billion. United's "United Next" strategy (announced 2023) targets $5 billion+ in annual pre-tax margins by 2025-2030 through fleet renewal, network optimization, and technology investments. Challenges include supply chain disruptions and fuel volatility, but strong corporate travel rebound and international expansion position it for growth in a consolidating industry.

## Recent Developments
- **Q2 2024 Earnings (Reported July 17, 2024):** Record quarterly revenue of $14.99 billion (up 5.4% YoY); pretax earnings $1.20 billion (EPS $3.08 diluted, beating estimates); operating cash flow $3.0 billion; PRASM up 1.7%; CASM-ex up 3.8%. Capacity grew 5.6% YoY (source: UAL SEC 10-Q, earnings call transcript via Seeking Alpha).
- **Pilot Contract Ratification (September 13, 2024):** United's 15,000+ pilots ratified a 4-year deal with 40.2% average pay raise (effective through 2028), averting strike risks; adds ~$1.5 billion to annual costs but boosts retention (per Reuters, ALPA announcement).
- **Fleet Orders (September 25, 2024):** Committed to 123 Airbus A321neo and 80 Boeing 737 MAX jets as part of United Next; total backlog now ~700 aircraft (UAL investor relations).
- **Sustainability Milestone (October 7, 2024):** Launched first Sustainable Aviation Fuel (SAF) flight from LAX to ORD using 10% blended SAF (per company press release).
- **Operational Wins:** Record July 2024 load factor 86%; Q3 domestic capacity +2.5% YoY (preliminary ops update, October 1, 2024).

## Growth Strategy
- **United Next Plan (Launched April 2023):** $10B+ investment in 1,100+ new aircraft deliveries by 2032 (e.g., 300+ A321neo, 100+ 787-10s); retire 200+ regional jets to focus on mainline widebodies for higher yields. Targets 7-9% annual ASM growth through 2027.
- **Premium Revenue Focus:** 30%+ of fleet premium-configured; international expansion (e.g., new routes to Marrakesh, Morocco in Oct 2024; Cebu, Philippines in late 2024).
- **Technology/Ancillary:** App-based upgrades, "ConnectionSaver" tool (rolled out 2024); MileagePlus revenue projected >$10B in 2024.
- **Capital Allocation:** $7.5B debt reduction since 2021; $1.5B share repurchase authorized (ongoing); no dividends yet.

## Company and Sector Headwinds & Tailwinds

| Category     | Headwinds                                                                 | Tailwinds                                                                 |
|--------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| **Company** | Boeing delivery delays (only 14 787s in 2024 vs. 50 planned); pilot wage inflation (~$10B cumulative contracts); narrowbody engine issues (GTF on A320neos). | Strong balance sheet (liquidity $16.2B as of Q2); premium mix >25% revenue; MileagePlus cash cow (60%+ margins). |
| **Sector**  | Fuel prices (~$2.40/gal Q3 est.); macroeconomic slowdown (e.g., 1.5% US GDP Q3 forecast); overcapacity in domestic leisure; recession fears (per Goldman Sachs Oct 2024 note). | Pent-up travel demand (IATA: 2024 global passengers 4.7B); corporate travel rebound (+15% YoY Q2); international recovery (transatlantic +10% ASMs). |

## Existing Products/Services
- **Passenger:** Economy, Premium Economy (Premium Plus), Business (Polaris lounges at 5 hubs).
- **Cargo:** United Cargo (freighters + belly); 2023 revenue $1.5B.
- **Loyalty:** MileagePlus (credit card partnerships with Chase; co-branded spend $30B+ annually).
- **Ancillary:** Bags, seats, WiFi (Viasat/Starlink rollout 2024-2025).

## New Products/Services/Projects
- **Starlink WiFi (2025 Rollout):** Free high-speed internet on 1,000+ aircraft (FAA-approved Oct 2024).
- **Polaris NextGen Suites (2025+):** Door-enclosed private seats on 787-10s/A350s (MoU with Airbus July 2024).
- **United Next Regional Overhaul:** Add 150+ larger regional jets (E175s) by 2027, cut 200 smaller CRJs.
- **EV Ground Power Units:** 1,000+ units by 2030 for net-zero gates.

## Market Share Approximations
- US Domestic Passenger Revenue: ~17% (2023 DOT data; Q2 2024 est. 16.5% via Cirium).
- Global ASMs: ~5-6% (IATA 2023).
- Premium International: ~20% US share (transatlantic leader).

**Forecast:** +1-2% domestic share gain by 2026 via fleet advantage (vs. AA/DAL narrowbody constraints); international stable at 18-20% (per JPMorgan Oct 2024 note). Potential decline if recession hits leisure (-0.5% risk).

## Comparison to Competitors

| Metric (Q2 2024 or LTM) | UAL          | Delta (DAL)  | American (AAL) | Southwest (LUV) |
|-------------------------|--------------|--------------|----------------|-----------------|
| **Revenue**            | $14.99B     | $15.4B      | $14.3B        | $6.87B         |
| **PRASM Growth YoY**   | +1.7%       | +1.0%       | -1.5%         | -5.0%          |
| **Pretax Margin**      | 8.0%        | 11.5%       | 4.2%          | 1.8%           |
| **Debt/Liquidity**     | 0.7x        | 0.6x        | 1.8x          | 0.4x           |
| **Fleet Age**          | 15.5 yrs    | 14.2 yrs    | 12.8 yrs      | 11.8 yrs       |

*Sources: Company 10-Qs (July-Aug 2024). UAL leads international/premium growth but lags DAL on margins.*

## Partnerships, M&A
- **Partnerships:** Star Alliance (Lufthansa, Air Canada, ANA); Chase (MileagePlus cards, $25B+ spend); new: Azul (Brazil expansion, deepened 2024).
- **M&A:** None recent; past: ExpressJet integration (2019). Speculation on regional acquisitions (e.g., Envoy stake) low (per Barron's Oct 2024).

## Current and Potential Major Clients
- **Current:** Corporate (e.g., JPMorgan, Boeing contracts via MileagePlus; 40% revenue from top 100 corps); government/military charters.
- **Potential:** Tech giants (expanding SFO hub for Silicon Valley); Asia growth (targeting India/China corps post-codeshares).

## Other Qualitative Measures
- **ESG:** Committed to net-zero by 2050; 100% SAF uplift goal by 2030.
- **Labor Relations:** Improved post-contracts; employee NPS +20pts YoY.
- **Risks:** Geopolitical (e.g., Middle East routing cuts, 2% capacity hit Q3).
- **Catalysts:** Q3 earnings Oct 16, 2024; Boeing ramp-up 2025.

## Investment Recommendation
- **Buy Rating: 8/10 (Strong Buy)** â€“ Hold through Q3 earnings; compelling growth from United Next/international amid premium tailwinds. Cyclical risks moderate for growth-oriented portfolio.
- **Estimated Fair Value: $75** (26% upside from $59.58). Based on 8x 2025E EV/EBITDA ($10.5B est. per consensus; FactSet Oct 11), trading at 5.2x fwd vs. peers 6-7x. Assumes 10% EPS CAGR 2024-2027, fuel $2.50/gal. Moderate risk (beta 1.4) balanced by $15B+ liquidity.
